org.jstuff.trampoline

Class Trampoline<A>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jstuff.trampoline.Trampoline<A>
  • Type Parameters:
    A - The type of the calculated value

    public abstract class Trampoline<A>
extends Object
    A class that represents a calculation which, when run, will not overflow the stack.
    See Also:
    java-trampoline web site

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <B> Trampoline<B> flatMap(Function<A,Trampoline<B>> calcNextTrampoline)
      Creates a Trampoline that will return the result of the Trampoline that's returned from applying the passed function to the result of this Trampoline.
      <B> Trampoline<B> map(Function<A,B> transformValue)
      Creates a Trampoline that will return the result of applying the passed function to the result of this Trampoline.
      static <A> Trampoline<A> ret(A value)
      Creates a Trampoline that represents a constant value.
      A run()
      Evaluates this Trampoline in constant stack space (disregarding the stack space that is consumed by the functions used to construct this Trampoline).
      static <A> Trampoline<A> suspend(Supplier<Trampoline<A>> thunk)
      Creates a Trampoline that represents a thunk (an unevaluated calculation).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • ret

        public static <A> Trampoline<A> ret(A value)
        Creates a Trampoline that represents a constant value.
        Type Parameters:
        A - The type of the value
        Parameters:
        value - The value which will be returned by this Trampoline.
        Returns:
        A new Trampoline that represents the value.

      • suspend

        public static <A> Trampoline<A> suspend(Supplier<Trampoline<A>> thunk)
        Creates a Trampoline that represents a thunk (an unevaluated calculation).
        Type Parameters:
        A - The type of the value
        Parameters:
        thunk - A Supplier that will return a value
        Returns:
        A new Trampoline that represents the unevaluated calculation.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if thunk is null

      • run

        public final A run()
        Evaluates this Trampoline in constant stack space (disregarding the stack space that is consumed by the functions used to construct this Trampoline).
        Returns:
        The calculated value

      • map

        public final <B> Trampoline<B> map(Function<A,B> transformValue)
        Creates a Trampoline that will return the result of applying the passed function to the result of this Trampoline.
        Type Parameters:
        B - The transformed value's type
        Parameters:
        transformValue - The function used to transform the result of this Trampoline
        Returns:
        A new Trampoline that represents the application of transformValue to the result of this Trampoline
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if transformValue is null

      • flatMap

        public final <B> Trampoline<B> flatMap(Function<A,Trampoline<B>> calcNextTrampoline)
        Creates a Trampoline that will return the result of the Trampoline that's returned from applying the passed function to the result of this Trampoline.
        Type Parameters:
        B - The type of the value returned by the next Trampoline (and, consequently, the returned Trampoline)
        Parameters:
        calcNextTrampoline - The function used to calculate the next Trampoline
        Returns:
        A new Trampoline that represents the sequence of this Trampoline followed by the next Trampoline
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if calcNextTrampoline is null
